description: This course focuses on the implementation of core technologies in web design and development. With prior experience designing digital media assets, students in New Media I will put finger tips to keyboard to create rich interative experiences with the front-end technologies of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Through out the course, students will gain an understanding of user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design. Additional topics include UI/UX design principles, website planning, responsive web development, and general computer literacy.
learningOutcomes: Design intuitive, clean, and visually appealing web interfaces using modern HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Produce websites that dynamically display data from online feeds.
Integrate multimedia components such as audio and video into websites.
Demonstrate proficiency incorporating third-party libraries in a codebase to enhance the user experience
Use interactive forms to capture user data and store this information in databases
Use online systems, wireless technologies and/or video conferencing to participate in instructional tutorials and group collaboration
course.name: New Media I
notes: A working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator is required for this course.
Exercises are works in progress, as students learn new theories and apply knowledge of design and production techniques, as well as the use of digital technologies.
Assignments are projects that fulfill specific objectives put forth in assignment descriptions.
typeDescription: This course will be taught in-person and online using Canvas as a foundational platform and using video conferencing and email to communicate with and engage students. As a partically online course, much of the information for instruction, as well as the descriptions of exercises, assignments and projects, will be posted on Canvas in an easily accessible format, providing students the opportunity to work from a location of their choice. As a synchronous course, meeting times for each section (001 and 002) are set and listed above. Students will receive electronic communication providing login information for each class meeting in advance.
Students can take advantage of virutal office hours every Friday from 5pm-7pm.
